✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Enjoyable
question makes sense and is challenging!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: very fun, I like the twist in the rules for the Indian :p

my golf try:
l=list(zip(map(int,input().split()),(3,3,2,2)))
n=0
while l:
 (p,k),l=l[0],l[1:]
 n+=k*p*(p-1)//2
 for s,_ in l:n+=p*k*s
print(n)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clash, I like it! :)
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
It's a funny puzzle, OK with it

kiss = []
country = ["P", "N", "F", "S", "I"]
kiss = [3, 3, 2, 2, 0]
people = input().split()
data = [(country[i], int(people[i]), kiss[i]) for i in range(len(people))]
other_kiss = 0
each_other = 0

for i in range(len(data)):
    for j in range(i + 1, len(data)):
        if data[i][0] == "I" or data[j][0] == "I":
            continue
        else:
            total_interaction = data[i][1] * data[j][1]
            other_kiss += max(data[i][2], data[j][2]) * total_interaction


for i in range(len(data)):
    total_same_nationality = data[i][1] * (data[i][1] - 1) // 2  
    each_other += total_same_nationality * data[i][2]

total_cheek_kisses = other_kiss + each_other
print(total_cheek_kisses)

FYI, there is a Clash that is similar to this:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/7704003804918517221584d6848ebaf8b0e7

Goal section
* Please fix the typo: "tradtion" => "tradition".

Output section
* Please change "a" to "the".

Cases
* Please change the second pair of test/validator so that they are different.

* I would suggest the last pair of cases be moved to the beginning as they are simpler, and also they should be split into two pairs: one pair of cases involving no Indians, and another pair of cases involving Indians.

Stub generator
* Please use loopline to provide 5 integers instead of providing a single string.

Thanks.

Thank you for your feedback, I believe I fixed everything you said.  I'm just not sure which case you meant while saying about splitting it to distinguish between including Indians and no including them and why.

Thank you for making the changes.

Would you please also change "5 integers" to "5 space-separated integers" in Input section?

As for splitting the cases, I meant the first pair of test and validator. For example,

Test 1 remains the same: 0 1 1 0 0
Validator 1 will be similar: with two 0s and two 1s and zero Indian

Test 2 will be with three 0s and one 1s and 1 Indian
The original Validator 1 becomes Validator 2.

All the other cases will be shifted so that there will be 6 pairs of cases in total.

The reason for splitting is so that the two beginning cases cover two basic rules, one without Indians and the other with Indians.

Hope this clarifies :)
Now I get it, thanks. Done :)
